author: fradamt
content: It's not very clear why they are choosing to do that though (not to me at least), since it implies having to go through the deposit queue without earning rewards

author: greystroke
content: If I had to guess, it the tooling (or lack thereof) for consolidations.

author: nixo.eth
content: probably a bit too early to say much about it, but EthStaker has a Launchpad replacement in-progress

author: tersec
content: will it make the choice between "compounding" (i.e. 2048 ETH limit; 32 ETH validators "compound" too) and number (10 or less, or arbitrary amounts) more orthogonal?

author: nixo.eth
content: i don't understand the question - can you reword this with an example that would be difficult to handle on the existing launchpad?

author: tersec
content:
"Regular withdrawals" allow selection of number of validators, but compounding validators don't. But these are just two independent dimensions of choice, technically, (a) the validator type, and (b) how many of them.

And this isn't just a case of, well, how many people want to stake not only 2048 ETH but 2048 ETH (testnet or otherwise)*however many validators, but many people intentionally might choose to stake much less than 2048 ETH/validator but still want a "compounding" [yes, a misnomer] validator.
